Datatable.LocalizationPair: Basic Fighter

Fighters use advanced comm systems to target and destroy enemy ships. They generally go for Bombers (whether they are acting offensively or defensively), but will target other ships if there are no Bombers in range.
Advanced Fighter
This newer generation of fighter is an improvement, as it uses more advanced (and expensive) materials and takes advantage of improved engine and weapon efficiency.
Basic Bomber
Bombers are designed to target large enemy ships. Their limited range means they will tend to go for what is closer, but have advantages against larger ships.
Advanced Bomber
Improved Bombers are more dangerous not only for their speed and maneuverability but also for their increasingly lethal paylods, developed with the latest military technology.
Heavy Fighter
Sacrificing armor for improved weapon systems, pirate modifications have raised critical damage at the expense of some durability compared to the Advanced Fighter model.
Light Bomber
By stripping the Advanced Bomber of some protective shielding pirate modifications have made it a little more fragile, but improved its evasion capabilities, while packing the same punch.
Squadron Shifter
The antimatter auxiliary engines stocked in this support module are mounted before deployment. They greatly improve durability and dodge capability of squadrons.
Strike Multiplier
These adamantian-enhanced weapons systems are mounted before deployment. They maintain a high level of damage and improve the probability of critical hits.
Smart Flak
By using self-aware individual shards as part of larger explosive devices, pieces of flak can select slightly better paths that increase the probabilitys of impact with enemy projectiles.
Increases efficiency of the ship's Flak against Missiles & F/Bs
Repulsive Plates
Cycling powerful, irregularly-timed magnetic fields through the hull, this disposable armor greatly reduces the probability of enemy guns successfully hitting friendly squadrons.
Flak targeting F/Bs of the ship are 50% less effective (does not add up)
Squadron
Show only Squadron ship modules
The cumulative number of Bomber units
The cumulative number of Fighter units
A Swarm of Locusts

Pirates are rarely at the forefront of new technologies. But this time they have cutting edge military systems, and are producing ships equipped with advanced fighter and bomber squadrons. The carrier ships themselves are not very impressive--re-purposed freighters and cargo vessels--but they are loading them with swarms of small but effective interceptors. These new craft are appearing all over the galaxy, threatening trade, travel, and sentient lives. It is time to put rivalries aside, get together, and stamp out this new pirate menace. New tactics and technologies are being used, and whoever takes out more of the pirate fleets is likely to have an edge in learning and adopting them.
Pirates are deploying new ships with fighters and bombers. This threat to galactic order--and your imperial plans--must be stopped.
Destroy all the pirate fleets
The locations of the pirate fleets are indicated on the galactic map. You have to defeat at least $Amount04Name fleets to have a chance to receive a Reward.

Now that the dust has settled and the cheering is over, it's time to figure out how the pirates got their hands on such advanced technology. There is a mystery here, and to prevent another pirate incursion it has to be solved.
The Power behind the Drones

Your experts in techno-xeno-anthropology are unanimous in their opinion: the style, code, engineering quality, and substrates all point to techniques and processes used by the Mavros. This means that somewhere in the galaxy a hidden research site--well-equipped with both tools and renegade, troublemaking engineers--is selling fighter/bomber technology to anybody who can afford it. Unless this base can be found and this unpleasant business stopped, the Mavros will continue causing trouble for everybody. On the other hand, engineers who are that clever could be useful if their politics were slightly readjusted... Perhaps a generous bribe--er, signing bonus--could convince them to come work for you rather than somebody else.
Find the Mavros who are building the pirate fighter/bomber technology. Bring along a generous bribe, and you might be able to convince them to work for you…
Search the indicated Curiosity $CuriosityPlanetName on the planet with $Amount01Name of [Strat04anti-matterColored] #EB897C#Antimatter#REVERT# -- but hurry. It's winner-takes-all!
Search the Curiosity when you are ready to pay $Amount01Name of [Strat04anti-matterColored] #EB897C#Antimatter#REVERT#.

Well, that was interesting. The Mavros weren't even bothered when your armada showed up at their orbital station; they figured you were just another customer. Now the engineers and their tech is yours--it's time to exploit your investment!
Something has gone wrong… Either another Empire beat you to it, or somebody was angry enough to destroy the planet! Regardless, you will not be able to uncover the secret of the Mavros technology.
A Factory of One's Own

As it turns out, the Mavros had set up quite an impressive "clean" facility on their orbital station. They were happy to leave it behind, however, as they had reached the limit of what they could do with the station's resources--and besides, luxury shipments were rare. Now that the fiscal and technical weight of your empire is behind them, they can start developing the next generation of their technology. It all starts with a new site and a new facility, generously funded by you, and staffed by them.
In order to get the most out of the Mavros engineers and their technology, you will need to build a new Improvement.
Build the Mavros Skunkworks System Improvement on Empire
This is a unique Improvement (one per empire)

The work is impressive. For all their reputation as crazed troublemakers, when they are focused and sober the Mavros are superlative engineers. Your fleets will profit from the new factory, and your finest tacticians have already worked out dangerous new battle plans.
Bosun Jennifer Rach

Rach was part of a pirate band who broke into an Endless research station and were promptly caught by the security systems. A passing Amoeba ship caught their distress signal, but by the time the Amoeba arrived a Dust-enhanced Rach had already freed her team, cracked the research station lock, looted it, and augmented their ship. As the Amoeba were headed to the Academy she decided to go with them, in spite of the pleas of her heartbroken partner, Sego, and her angry boss, Nico the Psycho, who viewed her skills as a ticket to riches. Thanks to her skills with flight technology, she has since made a name for herself as an inventor and test pilot of new and improbable craft and their uses in battle. It is whispered that even though she has the training of the Academy, deep down she still has the heart of a buccaneer…
Pirates

The universe is full of wealth and riches, and there are those who would rather take what has already been created than do the hard work themselves. While military expeditions generally destroy these bands of pirates or raiders before they become too powerful, one syndicate of pirate-traders, known as ABC (the Autonomous Bastards' Collective), has grown sufficiently large and wealthy to constitute a serious threat to galactic development. Diplomacy and interaction may be required to control them, and an enterprising few may figure out ways to harness their mercenary lust...
Mavros Skunkworks

As tradition demands they are unofficial, off-budget, and highly effective. The Mavros engineers working in this apparently nondescript factory and lab are tasked with developing new military-industrial technology. If explosions are a reliable measure, they are doing wonderfully.
Repair Protocol
Post-battle, surviving Squadron crews aid in the repair of their damaged host Ship
Any Ship with surviving Squadron Modules repairs by X per Squadron
Strafing Run
These orders ensure that the fighters' primary role is bomber protection, focusing on the destruction of enemy fighters intercepting bombers.
All Fighters escort Bombers +10% critical attack probability on Fighters & Bombers
Fleet Escort
Rather than going on the attack, fighters are ordered to defend the fleet vessels. Their familairity with the ships and maneuvers give them improved odds to dodge attacks.
All Fighters escort friendly Ships +10% dodge probability on Fighters & Bombers
For the Cause
Fighters and Bombers are used as cannon fodder, drawing enemy fire and improving the survival odds of the larger ships in the fleet.
-50% max Health on Squadrons +1% damage reduction to Fleet per Squadron
Wing Coordination
By sharing data and analyses in real time between squadrons, they gain notable tactical advantages over their enemies.
+1% damage by Squadrons per Squadron in Fleet

Fighters protect enemy ships from your Bomber attacks. Alternatively, they escort and protect enemy Bombers while they execute their mission.

Fighters protect enemy ships from your Bomber attacks. Alternatively, they escort and protect enemy Bombers while they execute their mission. Critical attacks double the damage Fighters deal.
Mavros Methodology
Unorthodox, dangerous, aggressive, and full of shortcuts, Mavros scientific methods are highly effective if the scientists and engineers survive.
Portable N-Way Qcomms

While quantum communication between two nodes is relatively well understood, this technology uses multiple related reactions to allow quantum communications between multiple connected sites simultaneously.
Unlock "Wing Coordination" Battle Tactic
Start Squadron Attack
